title: Summer Storms
description: Kaci Skiles Laws new collection of poetry and prose, Summer Storms, is "for the child that dies inside us all. It is slow, everything gradual" (from "I Tell Him I Will Never Eat Him"). Summer Storms begins reflecting on motherhood and how the author's relationships changed once she became a mother. The highs and lows and family dysfunction are duly noted before the reader goes bouncing back to a place in time when the author was just an observer of the adult world and adult things.
author: Kaci Skiles Laws
